short: Settlement services and orientation for individuals and families.
offers: Obtaining IDs & documents (PR, OHIP, driver’s licence)
Personal income tax filing (see Free Tax Clinic program)
eligibility: Open to newcomers; focus on Vietnamese community but serves all eligible clients. Some workshops/classes specify PR/refugee eligibility.
languages: French referral via Centre Francophone du Grand Toronto

notes: Resume writing services are free (IRCC-funded) at VWAT.
eligibility: Primarily newcomers; open consult with employment team.

short: Free services for seniors: social connection, benefits, wellness.
offers: Assistance with OAS, GIS, CPP applications
Ontario Seniors Dental Care Program (65+) applications
Toronto Subsidized Housing applications (Toronto Housing + Service Canada accounts)
Job search help (resumes, cover letters, interviewing, networking)
eligibility: Seniors in Toronto; certain benefits have age/income requirements.
notes: Additional city-wide resources include Toronto Seniors Helpline; community supports; in-home help; transportation; friendly outreach; workshops; technology training; financial guidance; elder abuse prevention; emergency preparedness; caregiver supports.

short: Volunteer & leadership opportunities for ages ~13–25; camps & festivals.
offers: Summer Day Camp (leadership development, CSJ-funded roles)
Cultural festival volunteering (Lunar New Year, Trung Sisters, Children’s Lantern Festival)
Recreational activities; field trips; arts & crafts
goals: Supportive networks with community and peers
eligibility: Youth (approx. 13–25). Newcomers prioritized but open to broader community.
